CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: [21][22][23][24][25] On the other hand , fused heteroarenes have been utilized as electron - donating units for the synthesis of DPP - based conjugated polymers. The incorporation of an extended fused aromatic unit in the polymer backbone is expected to induce strong intermolecular interactions ( π-π stacking ) , affording high crystallinity to the polymer and thus resulting in a reduced energy barrier for charge carrier transport. Therefore , the DPP - based copolymers combined with fused heteroarenes have shown low band - gaps with excellent charge transport characteristics and thus a high short circuit current density ( J SC ) of the solar cell device. [26][27][28][29] However , since low band - gap DPP - based copolymers usually exhibit a relatively high - lying highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) energy level , leading to a low open circuit voltage ( V OC ) of PSCs , a compromise between the band - gap and the HOMO energy level of DPP - based polymers is critically required. One way to solve the trade - off between V OC and J SC of the PSC based on low band - gap polymers is to introduce arene groups which have weak electron - donating power. When a benzene or naphthalene group which has a weak electrondonating nature was incorporated into DPP - based copolymers , a low - lying HOMO energy level was achieved without a large sacrifice of the band - gap , and as a result PCEs were improved with enhanced V OC s as compared to the counterpart polymer with a strong electron - donating unit. 30,31 Anthracene is also an interesting building block as an electron - donating unit for low band - gap conjugated polymers , because the electron - donating power of anthracene is relatively weaker than fused heteroarenes such as thieno [3,2-b]thiophene and dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]thiophene , and therefore , anthracene - based copolymers are expected to have a low - lying HOMO energy level. Furthermore , anthracene - based copolymers usually exhibit high crystallinity and high charge carrier mobility due to the coplanar fused structure of the anthracene unit. Therefore , a combination of DPP and anthracene could be ideal , thus leading to high J SC and V OC . Nevertheless , a few studies have reported that anthracene - DPP conjugated polymers show low PCEs less than 3% . 32 Here , we synthesized low band - gap copolymers incorporating 9,10-bis (5-(2-ethylhexyl)thiophen-2-yl)anthracene ( TA ) and DPP as an electron - donating and electron - withdrawing unit , respectively. Very recently , we have successfully demonstrated that TA is a promising electron - donating moiety of medium band - gap conjugated copolymers for high performance polymer solar cells. 33 In conjunction with its weak electrondonating characteristics , TA possesses an extended conjugation in 2-D , which is expected to enhance the light absorption and self - assembly of the resulting copolymer.

Let's think step by step.

1. fused heteroarenes (thieno [3,2-b]thiophene, dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]thiophene)
2. benzene
3. naphthalene
4. anthracene
5. 9,10-bis (5-(2-ethylhexyl)thiophen-2-yl)anthracene (TA)

These are the Material Name entities mentioned in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. fused heteroarenes (thieno [3,2-b]thiophene, dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]thiophene)
2. anthracene
3. 9,10-bis (5-(2-ethylhexyl)thiophen-2-yl)anthracene (TA)

These are the Material Name entities that clearly refer to materials mentioned in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| fused heteroarenes (thieno [3,2-b]thiophene, dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]thiophene) |
| anthracene |
| 9,10-bis (5-(2-ethylhexyl)thiophen-2-yl)anthracene (TA) |

Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: [21][22][23][24][25] On the other hand , fused heteroarenes have been utilized as electron - donating units for the synthesis of DPP - based conjugated polymers. The incorporation of an extended fused aromatic unit in the polymer backbone is expected to induce strong intermolecular interactions ( π-π stacking ) , affording high crystallinity to the polymer and thus resulting in a reduced energy barrier for charge carrier transport. Therefore , the DPP - based copolymers combined with fused heteroarenes have shown low band - gaps with excellent charge transport characteristics and thus a high short circuit current density ( J SC ) of the solar cell device. [26][27][28][29] However , since low band - gap DPP - based copolymers usually exhibit a relatively high - lying highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) energy level , leading to a low open circuit voltage ( V OC ) of PSCs , a compromise between the band - gap and the HOMO energy level of DPP - based polymers is critically required. One way to solve the trade - off between V OC and J SC of the PSC based on low band - gap polymers is to introduce arene groups which have weak electron - donating power. When a benzene or naphthalene group which has a weak electrondonating nature was incorporated into DPP - based copolymers , a low - lying HOMO energy level was achieved without a large sacrifice of the band - gap , and as a result PCEs were improved with enhanced V OC s as compared to the counterpart polymer with a strong electron - donating unit. 30,31 Anthracene is also an interesting building block as an electron - donating unit for low band - gap conjugated polymers , because the electron - donating power of anthracene is relatively weaker than fused heteroarenes such as thieno [3,2-b]thiophene and dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]thiophene , and therefore , anthracene - based copolymers are expected to have a low - lying HOMO energy level. Furthermore , anthracene - based copolymers usually exhibit high crystallinity and high charge carrier mobility due to the coplanar fused structure of the anthracene unit. Therefore , a combination of DPP and anthracene could be ideal , thus leading to high J SC and V OC . Nevertheless , a few studies have reported that anthracene - DPP conjugated polymers show low PCEs less than 3% . 32 Here , we synthesized low band - gap copolymers incorporating 9,10-bis (5-(2-ethylhexyl)thiophen-2-yl)anthracene ( TA ) and DPP as an electron - donating and electron - withdrawing unit , respectively. Very recently , we have successfully demonstrated that TA is a promising electron - donating moiety of medium band - gap conjugated copolymers for high performance polymer solar cells. 33 In conjunction with its weak electrondonating characteristics , TA possesses an extended conjugation in 2-D , which is expected to enhance the light absorption and self - assembly of the resulting copolymer.

Let's think step by step.

1. fused heteroarenes
2. DPP (Diphenylphenylene)
3. HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) energy level
4. PSCs (Perovskite Solar Cells)
5. arene groups (Benzene or Naphthalene)
6. anthracene
7. thieno [3,2-b]thiophene
8. dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]thiophene
9. TA (9,10-bis (5-(2-ethylhexyl)thiophen-2-yl)anthracene)

These are the property names identified in the paragraph. Some of them are chemical compounds, while others are energy levels or acronyms for specific materials or solar cell types.

4. anthracene

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: [21][22][23][24][25] On the other hand , fused heteroarenes have been utilized as electron - donating units for the synthesis of DPP - based conjugated polymers. The incorporation of an extended fused aromatic unit in the polymer backbone is expected to induce strong intermolecular interactions ( π-π stacking ) , affording high crystallinity to the polymer and thus resulting in a reduced energy barrier for charge carrier transport. Therefore , the DPP - based copolymers combined with fused heteroarenes have shown low band - gaps with excellent charge transport characteristics and thus a high short circuit current density ( J SC ) of the solar cell device. [26][27][28][29] However , since low band - gap DPP - based copolymers usually exhibit a relatively high - lying highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) energy level , leading to a low open circuit voltage ( V OC ) of PSCs , a compromise between the band - gap and the HOMO energy level of DPP - based polymers is critically required. One way to solve the trade - off between V OC and J SC of the PSC based on low band - gap polymers is to introduce arene groups which have weak electron - donating power. When a benzene or naphthalene group which has a weak electrondonating nature was incorporated into DPP - based copolymers , a low - lying HOMO energy level was achieved without a large sacrifice of the band - gap , and as a result PCEs were improved with enhanced V OC s as compared to the counterpart polymer with a strong electron - donating unit. 30,31 Anthracene is also an interesting building block as an electron - donating unit for low band - gap conjugated polymers , because the electron - donating power of anthracene is relatively weaker than fused heteroarenes such as thieno [3,2-b]thiophene and dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]thiophene , and therefore , anthracene - based copolymers are expected to have a low - lying HOMO energy level. Furthermore , anthracene - based copolymers usually exhibit high crystallinity and high charge carrier mobility due to the coplanar fused structure of the anthracene unit. Therefore , a combination of DPP and anthracene could be ideal , thus leading to high J SC and V OC . Nevertheless , a few studies have reported that anthracene - DPP conjugated polymers show low PCEs less than 3% . 32 Here , we synthesized low band - gap copolymers incorporating 9,10-bis (5-(2-ethylhexyl)thiophen-2-yl)anthracene ( TA ) and DPP as an electron - donating and electron - withdrawing unit , respectively. Very recently , we have successfully demonstrated that TA is a promising electron - donating moiety of medium band - gap conjugated copolymers for high performance polymer solar cells. 33 In conjunction with its weak electrondonating characteristics , TA possesses an extended conjugation in 2-D , which is expected to enhance the light absorption and self - assembly of the resulting copolymer.

Let's think step by step.

1. High crystallinity: This is a material property, but it does not have a specific value or unit associated with it as it is a qualitative description of the material's structure.
2. Reduced energy barrier for charge carrier transport: This is also a material property, but it does not have a specific value or unit associated with it as it is a qualitative description of the material's ability to transport charges.
3. Low band-gaps: This is a material property with values typically expressed in electronvolts (eV).
4. Excellent charge transport characteristics: This is a material property, but it does not have a specific value or unit associated with it as it is a qualitative description of the material's ability to transport charges efficiently.
5. High short circuit current density (J SC): This is a material property with values typically expressed in amperes per square centimeter (A/cm²).
6. Open circuit voltage ( V OC ): This is a material property with values typically expressed in volts (V).
7. Relatively high-lying HOMO energy level: This is a material property with values typically expressed in electronvolts (eV).
8. Compromise between the band-gap and the HOMO energy level: This is not a material property, but rather a requirement or goal in the design of materials.
9. Weak electron-donating power: This is a material property, but it does not have a specific value or unit associated with it as it is a qualitative description of the material's ability to donate electrons.
10. Low-lying HOMO energy level: This is a material property with values typically expressed in electronvolts (eV).
11. Enhanced V OCs: This is a material property, but it does not have a specific value or unit associated with it as it is a qualitative description of an improvement in open circuit voltage.
12. PCEs: This is a material property with values typically expressed as a percentage.
13. Extended conjugation in 2-D: This is a material property, but it does not have a specific value or unit associated with it as it is a qualitative description of the material's electronic structure.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. Low band-gaps: Values typically expressed in electronvolts (eV)
2. High short circuit current density (J SC): Values typically expressed in amperes per square centimeter (A/cm²)
3. Open circuit voltage ( V OC ): Values typically expressed in volts (V)
4. Relatively high-lying HOMO energy level: Values typically expressed in electronvolts (eV)
5. Low-lying HOMO energy level: Values typically expressed in electronvolts (eV)
6. Enhanced V OCs: Values typically expressed in volts (V)
7. PCEs: Values typically expressed as a percentage.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property          | Value                   |
|------------------|------------------------|
| Low band-gaps     | Values typically expressed in electronvolts (eV) |
| High short circuit current density (J SC) | Values typically expressed in amperes per square centimeter (A/cm²) |
| Open circuit voltage ( V OC ) | Values typically expressed in volts (V) |
| Relatively high-lying HOMO energy level | Values typically expressed in electronvolts (eV) |
| Low-lying HOMO energy level | Values typically expressed in electronvolts (eV) |
| Enhanced V OCs | Values typically expressed in volts (V) |
| PCEs | Values typically expressed as a percentage. |
